segments.text: I notice the boy stretching for the cookie jar, completely ignoring the unstable stool beneath him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, waiting for a handout like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless they’re being right in front of their mother.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is so focused on drying that plate that she’s oblivious to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children even realize how dangerous this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around soon and sees what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those moments where everything could go wrong in an instant.
segments.speaker: PAR
